question: Question 11-11/09/2018 Fuel is being loaded into the core. The operator is using a 1/M plot to monitor core loading. Which ONE of the following conditions would result in a non-conservative prediction of core critical mass, i.e., the reactor would reach criticality prior to the predicted critical mass?

answers.answer: a. The detector is too far away from the source and the fuel.
b. The detector is too close to the source and the fuel.
answers.feedback: Incorrect. REF: Burn, Section 5.5, pg. 5-18 A detector that is too far from the source and fuel will underestimate the effects of adding fuel, since the measured counts will not appreciably increase with each fuel element addition.

answers.answer: c. Excessive time is allowed between fuel elements being loaded.
answers.feedback: Incorrect. REF: Burn, Section 5.5, pg. 5-18 A detector that is too far from the source and fuel will underestimate the effects of adding fuel, since the measured counts will not appreciably increase with each fuel element addition.

answers.answer: d. A fuel element is placed between the source and the detector.
answers.feedback: Incorrect. REF: Burn, Section 5.5, pg. 5-18 A detector that is too far from the source and fuel will underestimate the effects of adding fuel, since the measured counts will not appreciably increase with each fuel element addition.
